intro: Neogaillonia puberula, commonly known as the hairy neogaillonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture due to the fine hairs covering their surface. Neogaillonia puberula is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
